channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: This Republican congressman wants to end gerrymandering for good
item.description: California voted to approve Prop 50, a measure to change election maps. Rep. Kevin Kiley, whose district will be impacted by the new map, has introduced legislation banning mid-decade gerrymandering.
item.content:encoded: California voted to approve Prop 50, a measure to change election maps. Rep. Kevin Kiley, whose district will be impacted by the new map, has introduced legislation banning mid-decade gerrymandering.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: A mayor with global roots: Zohran Mamdani's rise resonates far beyond New York
item.description: Uganda-born son of Indian immigrants turned NYC mayor Zohran Mamdani is drawing global attention — especially from progressives eyeing his playbook.
item.content:encoded: Uganda-born son of Indian immigrants turned NYC mayor Zohran Mamdani is drawing global attention — especially from progressives eyeing his playbook.
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: People working on climate and energy projects say Trump's cuts are short-sighted
item.description: Early in the government shutdown, the Trump administration announced billions in cuts to Biden-era climate and energy projects, calling them wasteful. Recipients say the cuts are short-sighted.
item.content:encoded: Early in the government shutdown, the Trump administration announced billions in cuts to Biden-era climate and energy projects, calling them wasteful. Recipients say the cuts are short-sighted.
item.dc:creator: Ishan Thakore

item.title: A deep dive into the Trump administration's firing of immigration judges
item.description: The Trump administration is firing scores of immigration judges, and bringing on dozens of others, as it seeks to boost mass deportations. NPR analyzed patterns in hiring and firing.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is firing scores of immigration judges, and bringing on dozens of others, as it seeks to boost mass deportations. NPR analyzed patterns in hiring and firing.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Despite higher tourist visa fees, more Mexicans are visiting the U.S.
item.description: The U.S. is seeing a decline in international tourists this year, about 9 percent. The number of Canadian visitors has plummeted. But after an initial drop, there's an uptick in travelers from Mexico.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. is seeing a decline in international tourists this year, about 9 percent. The number of Canadian visitors has plummeted. But after an initial drop, there's an uptick in travelers from Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Angela Kocherga

item.title: Mamdani supporters see an opening for more hopeful politics in his win
item.description: Zohran Mamdani will be the next mayor of America's biggest city. But voters who elected him say the hopeful tone and big ideas of Mamdani's campaign could resonate beyond New York City.
item.content:encoded: Zohran Mamdani will be the next mayor of America's biggest city. But voters who elected him say the hopeful tone and big ideas of Mamdani's campaign could resonate beyond New York City.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: The author of 'We Were Liars' on her passionate readers' 'big reactions' to her work
item.description: We speak to E. Lockhart, author of the best-selling novel We Were Liars, about her new book, We Fell Apart.
item.content:encoded: We speak to E. Lockhart, author of the best-selling novel We Were Liars, about her new book, We Fell Apart.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: What we know about the UPS plane crash in Louisville
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board has begun its investigation into Tuesday's UPS cargo plane crash at Louisville, Ky. At least eleven people died when the MD-11 crashed during takeoff.
item.content:encoded: The National Transportation Safety Board has begun its investigation into Tuesday's UPS cargo plane crash at Louisville, Ky. At least eleven people died when the MD-11 crashed during takeoff.
item.dc:creator: Justin Hicks

item.title: Singer Brandi Carlile talks about retreating from the version of herself on stage
item.description: Singer Brandi Carlile talks about writing her new album by retreating from the version of herself on stage.
item.content:encoded: Singer Brandi Carlile talks about writing her new album by retreating from the version of herself on stage.

item.title: Tariffs aren't a presidential power, says California Attorney General
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with California AG Rob Bonta about tariffs arguments at the Supreme Court, presidential power and the legal fights California is waging against the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with California AG Rob Bonta about tariffs arguments at the Supreme Court, presidential power and the legal fights California is waging against the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan
